conclusion: Determine the friction force of block A on the inclined plane when θ is changed to 30°.
For block A to rest, the gravitational force component along the incline must equal the friction force.
The gravitational force component along the incline is 0.6Mg.
When θ is changed to 30°, and cylinder B is introduced.
With M = 4m, evaluate the new forces.
The normal force N' due to cylinder B is N' = mg cos(30°) - f' sin(30°).
The friction force f' is f' = mg sin(30°) + N' cos(30°).
The normal force F on block A is F = Mg cos(30°) + f' cos(30°) + N' sin(30°).
The friction force f on A is f = Mg sin(30°) + f' sin(30°) - N' cos(30°).
The friction force of block A on the slope when θ = 30° is 11/8 mg.
